theme.description: A professional, distraction-free environment that mimics real-world developer tools. High clarity, neutral tones, and precise typography.

rules: NO gradients on buttons or backgrounds.
Use 'Slate' (blue-grey) scale for neutrals, never pure black/grey.
Primary color used ONLY for main actions (Submit, Run Code, Login).
Backgrounds should be white or very pale slate (#f8fafc).
Code snippets and editor must use JetBrains Mono.

strategies.dashboard: Grid layout with 12 columns. Widgets span 3, 4, or 6 columns.
strategies.coding_page: Three-pane layout: Problem (Left, 25%), Editor (Center, 50%), Output/Chat (Right, 25%). Resizable if possible.
strategies.auth_page: Centered card on a subtle grid pattern background.

customization.buttons: Solid colors, no shadows, sharp or slightly rounded corners (rounded-md).
customization.cards: Flat white background, 1px border (border-slate-200), no shadow or very subtle hover shadow.
customization.inputs: Gray border, white background, clear focus ring (ring-2 ring-primary/20).

specific_components.name: CodeEditor
specific_components.description: A wrapper around Monaco Editor or CodeMirror. Must support Python syntax highlighting.

specific_components.name: BROMentor
specific_components.description: Chat interface for the AI mentor. Looks like a messaging app (Slack/Discord style).

specific_components.name: SkillTrack
specific_components.description: Visual progress bar or step-wizard for the DSA module.

images.tech_logos: Use text labels or generic icons from Lucide (e.g., Server, Database, Cpu) to represent roles.

rules: Buttons scale down slightly on click (active:scale-95).
Hover states should be instant or very fast (duration-150).
Page transitions: Simple fade-in (opacity-0 to opacity-100).
Ensure contrast ratio of 4.5:1 for normal text.
All interactive elements must have aria-labels if no text is present.
Use semantic HTML (main, section, article, aside).

instructions_to_main_agent: Implement the 'Role Selection' as a mandatory step after signup.
The 'Arrays' module in DSA Track is the core feature. Make it prominent.
The 'BRO' AI mentor should be accessible from the coding page.
Use 'localStorage' to mock backend persistence for Phase 1.
Ensure the code editor can 'run' python code (mock the execution or use a client-side runner like Skulpt if feasible, otherwise mock output).
Strictly follow the 'Light Neutral' theme. No dark mode for now.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur) sparingly (only for sticky headers).
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms.
You MUST NOT center align the app container.
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations.
NEVER: use AI assistant Emoji characters like ðŸ¤–ðŸ§  etc for icons. Use Lucide icons.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable.
Subtle grain textures, noise overlays, custom cursors, selection states, and loading animations: separates good from extraordinary.
Main agent relies on these image URLs. Missing categories = main agent will use placeholder text which is FORBIDDEN
Prioritize using pre-existing components from src/components/ui when applicable
